Class Scanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scanner

  • public class Scanner
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses the light sensor to identify the angle of both light sources by identifying the peaks of light intensity when rotating in both directions Uses the ultrasonic sensor to determine distance to nearest object at specific angle Called on by Locator for fixing position
    Author:
    Allen Gurdus, Victor Sacristan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scanner(NXTRegulatedMotor theMotor, LightSensor theLS, UltrasonicSensor theUS)
      Constructor for Scanner

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] bomb(int startAngle, int finishAngle)
      obtain the distance and angle of the bomb calls on scanBomb for each scan
      boolean checkProblem()
      return the boolean problem.
      int distanceAt(int angle)
      Measures distance to nearest object with ultrasonic sensor Called on by checkWall() method in Locator to check distance to nearest wall
      int identifyPeaks()
      Identifies pea light intensity Uses threshold light intensity to know when to stop scanning Called on by lightScan method
      float[] lightScan(int startAngle, int finishAngle)
      Identifies four angles of peak light intensity (two in each direction of scan) Angles are measured precisely by scanning in both direction and averaging the two results Determines peak by using threshold value to identify when one peak has passed and it can start scanning for another
      int[] scanBomb(int startAngle, int finishAngle)
      obtain the distance and angle of the bomb for only one scan

    • Method Detail

      • lightScan

        public float[] lightScan(int startAngle,
                int finishAngle)
        Identifies four angles of peak light intensity (two in each direction of scan) Angles are measured precisely by scanning in both direction and averaging the two results Determines peak by using threshold value to identify when one peak has passed and it can start scanning for another
        Parameters:
        startAngle -
        finishAngle -
        Returns:
        angles

      • identifyPeaks

        public int identifyPeaks()
        Identifies pea light intensity Uses threshold light intensity to know when to stop scanning Called on by lightScan method
        Returns:

         int finishAngle)

      • distanceAt

        public int distanceAt(int angle)
        Measures distance to nearest object with ultrasonic sensor Called on by checkWall() method in Locator to check distance to nearest wall

      • checkProblem

        public boolean checkProblem()
        return the boolean problem. True if problem, false if everything is ok
